> I have been using mock objects (in particular EasyMock -
> http://tammofreese.de/easymock/index.html, it's great!) to ease the sort
of
> pain you are talking about.
>

I myself tended to over do the use of mock objects. After quite some time it
was a real pain maintaining the mock objects. Thus now I am very careful
with the use of mock objects. In model 2 I would have to fake every business
logic class! I know, that using functional tests as tests for the
presentation layer is not XP. However, functional tests also test parts of
the presentation layer (use code coverage tools to check the validity of
your tests) in model 2. And if your code coverage isn't too good, it is IMHO
an indicator for not too well chosen or too little functional tests.

Toyin
